name: Company Structure Creation
task:
Create a simple company structure in the database with the following elements:
1. Create 3 department nodes with label 'Department' and name property: Engineering, Marketing, and Sales
2. Create 6 employee nodes with label 'Employee' and properties for name, title, and hire_date
3. Create WORKS_IN relationships between employees and their departments
4. Create REPORTS_TO relationships between employees to establish a management hierarchy
5. Verify the structure you've created by running appropriate queries

Use realistic values for employee properties. Make sure at least one employee is a manager with other employees reporting to them.
response:
The simple company structure has been successfully created in the database.

I have created:
*   3 Department nodes ('Engineering', 'Marketing', 'Sales')
*   6 Employee nodes with names, titles, and hire dates.
*   WORKS\_IN relationships linking employees to their departments.
*   REPORTS\_TO relationships establishing the management hierarchy (Alice reports to Bob, Charlie reports to Diana, Eve reports to Frank).

Here is the result of the verification query showing the employees, their departments, and who they report to:

| EmployeeName    | Title               | HireDate   | Department  | ReportsTo   |
| :-------------- | :------------------ | :--------- | :---------- | :---------- |
| Alice Smith     | Software Engineer   | 2022-01-15 | Engineering | Bob Johnson |
| Bob Johnson     | Engineering Manager | 2018-06-01 | Engineering | None        |
| Charlie Brown   | Marketing Specialist| 2023-03-10 | Marketing   | Diana Prince|
| Diana Prince    | Marketing Manager   | 2019-09-20 | Marketing   | None        |
| Eve Adams       | Sales Representative| 2021-11-05 | Sales       | Frank White |
| Frank White     | Sales Manager       | 2017-04-18 | Sales       | None        |

The structure is now in place in your Neo4j database.

args.query: CREATE (:Employee {name: 'Alice Smith', title: 'Software Engineer', hire_date: '2022-01-15'}), (:Employee {name: 'Bob Johnson', title: 'Engineering Manager', hire_date: '2018-06-01'}), (:Employee {name: 'Charlie Brown', title: 'Marketing Specialist', hire_date: '2023-03-10'}), (:Employee {name: 'Diana Prince', title: 'Marketing Manager', hire_date: '2019-09-20'}), (:Employee {name: 'Eve Adams', title: 'Sales Representative', hire_date: '2021-11-05'}), (:Employee {name: 'Frank White', title: 'Sales Manager', hire_date: '2017-04-18'});

MATCH (e:Employee)-[:WORKS_IN]->(d:Department) OPTIONAL MATCH (e)-[:REPORTS_TO]->(m:Employee) RETURN e.name AS EmployeeName, e.title AS Title, e.hire_date AS HireDate, d.name AS Department, m.name AS ReportsTo ORDER BY Department, EmployeeName;

logs.name: wrapped_read_neo4j_cypher
logs.response: {'status': 'success', 'data': [{'EmployeeName': 'Alice Smith', 'Title': 'Software Engineer', 'HireDate': '2022-01-15', 'Department': 'Engineering', 'ReportsTo': 'Bob Johnson'}, {'EmployeeName': 'Bob Johnson', 'Title': 'Engineering Manager', 'HireDate': '2018-06-01', 'Department': 'Engineering', 'ReportsTo': None}, {'EmployeeName': 'Charlie Brown', 'Title': 'Marketing Specialist', 'HireDate': '2023-03-10', 'Department': 'Marketing', 'ReportsTo': 'Diana Prince'}, {'EmployeeName': 'Diana Prince', 'Title': 'Marketing Manager', 'HireDate': '2019-09-20', 'Department': 'Marketing', 'ReportsTo': None}, {'EmployeeName': 'Eve Adams', 'Title': 'Sales Representative', 'HireDate': '2021-11-05', 'Department': 'Sales', 'ReportsTo': 'Frank White'}, {'EmployeeName': 'Frank White', 'Title': 'Sales Manager', 'HireDate': '2017-04-18', 'Department': 'Sales', 'ReportsTo': None}]}
